authors.headline: Assistant Professor in Human Geography and Spatial Planning at Utrecht University

profile_positions.description:
Human Geography and Spatial Planning, Section: Social Urban Transitions
- Conducting research on understanding how planners and policy makers can improve the transportation experiences of all transit users, cyclists, and pedestrians, regardless of their age, income or mobility needs.
- Teaching undergraduate and graduate level students.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor in Human Geography and Spatial Planning

profile_positions.description:
Embedded Staff on Wheel-Trans Transformation Program team.  
Working to modernize and transform Wheel-Trans to better meet the needs of its customers:
- Providing data analysis and transportation planning services to best integrate Wheel-Trans specialized transit services into the TTC Family of Services, providing for multi-modal trip options for customers
- Developing customer satisfaction monitoring tools and customer analytics
- Updating customer policies and developing customer charters and strategies
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst,  Specialized Transit Service,  Wheel-Trans

profile_positions.description:
- Advising transit agencies through the development of tailored solutions on how to increase system optimization and customer satisfaction
- Giving presentations about best practices and the future of mobility, such as at the CUTA Forum 2017: Route to Innovation, and CityAge Toronto
profile_positions.title: Transit Advisory Consultant

profile_positions.description:
-Conducted research in active transportation, public transit, and Transit-Oriented Development through online survey design, statistical analysis, personal interviews, and literature reviews
-Researched the relationship between satisfaction and loyalty in transit
-Co-ordinated undergraduate and master’s students's research
-Lead the program assessment of Velo Quebec’s bicycle education program for school children
-Provided feedback on customer satisfaction surveys for several transit authorities
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant at TRAM (Transportation Research at McGill)
Instructor: URBP 536 & 537 Current Issues in Transportation
Co-Instructor: URBP 619 Land Use and Transportation Planning
Co-instructor: URBP 625 Principles and Practice: Public Transit Planning and Operations

profile_positions.description:
-Organized international Gewurz Lecture on Urban Design for over 300 guests
-Brought in Foster + Partners’ international representative of Masdar City, U.A.E.
-Coordinated volunteers for the McGill School of Urban Planning Anniversary Event 
-Organized field trips and a bi-monthly urban design seminar for the McGill School of Urban Planning
profile_positions.title: Coordinator of Teaching and Learning Activities
Guest lecturer: URBS 310/2 GEOG 333/2 Urban Transportation
